title: Bi-Weekly Movies, TV Shows, Documentaries & Podcasts Discussion Thread
selftext:
So, what is r/India watching of late?

Watched any premieres yesterday? Loved any movie that you saw recently and are dying to discuss it? Discovered any new series lately? Well, this is your space. Go crazy!

This is not just limited to Hollywood/Bollywood, nor to any particular language.

Feel free to share short films, or podcasts of your choice, too, and ask for recommendations for what to watch!

**Movies and Shows Thread is posted every two weeks on Saturday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Movies+thread+discussion+&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/e3cqi5nuw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=c6623226acf7856bb5a61313af7bec382c8525f1
comments: Just saw the film Ludo. Enjoyed those 2hrs entirely. Haven't seen a better Hindi movie in recent memory.
Started Love, Death & Robots. Highly recommend it if you're into the absurd and sci-fi.
Huge fan of the show. S3 was really good. This show helps partially fill my black mirror tv series cravings.

Currently at season 1, getting there, will binge this weekend.

I love black mirror dude! I'm just waiting for my brain to forget the show somehow so I watch it again lol.

watching the boys s03 and the show is amazing. karl urban and tony star has done phenomenal jobs with their acting but i miss aya cash on the show tho. after a bit of rusty s02 this season picked on very amazing actually. totally recommend.

Nice, enjoy the ride!
Haha, don't we all wish the same. Also, if you read books, you can try Exhalation by Ted Chiang. It's a set of short sci-fi stories and guaranteed BM vibes.
**For All Mankind** is an amazing show, if you like space sci-fi drama like Apollo 13 then you should definitely give this show a try.
I'm not much of reader. But will check it out since you mention it's short. Thanks.

~Greta gerwig's Little women (4.7/5)[ life story of four ambitious women living in the same household] 

and ladybird (3.6/5) [story of a 17 year old young women from a small place trying to have the best highschool experience and also trying to get into a College in a big city]


~ Call me by your name (4.5/5) [ love story , discovering their emotions and seperation]


~ Maid (4.5/5) [Netflix webseries about a single mother trying to make a better future for herself and her child]


~ 7 days (3.5/5) [ story of two indian American individuals whose respective parents set them up for an arranged marriage]

~ Abbott elementary (4.6/5) [ tv show involving the story of a group of teachers of an elementary school and their day to day struggles in school and their personal lives, comedy]

~ Heartstopper (4/5) [ Netflix webseries cute high school love story]


~ young royals (4/5) [ Netflix webseries love story b/w a commoner and a royal person going to the same school and their day to day struggles]
Latest episode was kick-ass! The look on HL was so satisfying to watch.
It blew me away, i absolutely fell in love with this show. Jibaro and sonny's edge are some of my personal favourite.
